definition: to expel/to oust/(dialect) to chase after/to try to catch up with
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: He might go of his own movement, but wouldn't be dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 他可以自動走開，但不能被攆走。

sentences.english: That naughty boy disturbs other children, therefore I expelled him.
sentences.chinese: 那個頑皮的男孩擾亂別的孩子，所以我就把他攆走了。

sentences.english: The naughty boy disturbed other children, so I booted him out.
sentences.chinese: 那個頑皮的男孩擾亂別的孩子，所以我就把他攆走了。

sentences.english: The club threw out a few members.
sentences.chinese: 俱樂部攆走了幾個會員。

sentences.english: If anyone comes begging at my door. I soon send him packing.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人到我門上討飯，我立刻把他攆走。

sentences.english: If the superintendents had caught sight of them, they would have driven such rags forth.
sentences.chinese: 如果看門人發現了他們，一定要攆走這些小化子。

sentences.english: If that man comes round here again, I'll put his nose out of joint.
sentences.chinese: 如果那人再到這兒來，我就要把他攆走。

sentences.english: That little tyrant harassed other kids, so I asked him to leave.
sentences.chinese: 那個頑皮的男孩擾亂別的孩子，所以我就把他攆走了。

sentences.english: The bartenders turfed him out of the bar when he started making a disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 當他開始在酒吧鬧起來時，侍者將他攆走了。
